newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan Apr trade surplus seen up sharply - institute.
newsitem.headline: Japan Apr trade surplus seen up sharply - institute.

text.p: Japan's customs-cleared trade surplus for April, due to be announced next Monday, is seen totalling 809.9 billion yen, up 156.9 percent from 315.3 billion yen a year earlier, private research company Daiwa Bank Research Institute said on Monday.

Japan's exports in April are likely to show a year-on-year rise of about 21 percent in value terms to 4,415.5 billion yen, while imports are seen rising eight percent to 3,605.6 billion yen, the institute said in a report.

In volume terms, exports in April are seen rising 13 percent, with car exports leading the way. Import volumes are likely to fall 5.1 percent year on year as the yen's weakness has helped to increase import prices, dampening overall imports.
